item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Saturday, April 12, 2025 at 12:30 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Google will let companies run Gemini models in their own data centers (144 points | 43 comments)
2. Google Is Winning on Every AI Front (408 points | 298 comments)
3. Rust to C compiler – 95.9% test pass rate, odd platforms (166 points | 81 comments)
4. Yakread's Ranking Algorithm (27 points | 1 comment)
5. You might not need WebSockets (294 points | 192 comments)
6. Why Your 'Harmonious' Team Is Failing (51 points | 34 comments)
7. Instant (YC S22) Is Hiring a Founding TypeScript Engineer ( | hide)
8. Vacheron Constantin breaks the world record for most complicated wristwatch (227 points | 200 comments)
9. Fedora change aims for 99% package reproducibility (366 points | 180 comments)
10. Intentionally Making Close Friends (2021) (231 points | 39 comments)
11. A 32-bit processor made with an atomically thin semiconductor (191 points | 34 comments)
12. C++: terser (shorter) lambda == SHORTY (ab-use?) (23 points | 7 comments)
13. Why 'Prince Rupert's Drop' Glass Is Strong Enough to Shatter a Bullet (26 points | 7 comments)
14. Adobe deletes Bluesky posts after backlash (388 points | 465 comments)
15. Erlang's not about lightweight processes and message passing (2023) (265 points | 144 comments)
16. Every picture from Venus' surface, ever (2021) (56 points | 8 comments)
17. Ames Shovel and Tool Catalog of Shovels, Spades and Scoops (1926) [pdf] (10 points | 4 comments)
18. Once lush Sahara was home to a surprisingly unique group of humans (113 points | 20 comments)
19. Blue Prince is a roguelike puzzle masterpiece (149 points | 86 comments)
20. AI can't stop making up software dependencies and sabotaging everything (4 points | discuss)
21. Lead is still bad for your brain (182 points | 144 comments)
22. $70M in 60 Seconds: How Insider Info Helped Someone 28x Their Money (575 points | 269 comments)
23. Show HN: Python at the Speed of Rust (13 points | 9 comments)
24. WebRTC for the Curious (156 points | 30 comments)
25. Bonobos use a kind of syntax once thought to be unique to humans (163 points | 106 comments)
26. Datastar: Web Framework for the Future? (223 points | 127 comments)
27. Windows 2000 Server named peak Microsoft (172 points | 232 comments)
28. But what if I want a faster horse? (1323 points | 560 comments)
29. Leaked data reveals Israeli govt campaign to remove pro-Palestine posts on Meta (952 points | 604 comments)
30. Bilinear interpolation on a quadrilateral using Barycentric coordinates (120 points | 29 comments)
item.guid: Hacker News Top Stories: Saturday, April 12, 2025 at 12:30 PM UTC
